definition: drum/CL:通[tong4],面[mian4]/to drum/to strike/to rouse/to bulge/to swell

to rise/to raise/to get up/to set out/to start/to appear/to launch/to initiate (action)/to draft/to establish/to get (from a depot or counter)/verb suffix, to start/starting from (a time, place, price etc)/classifier for occurrences or unpredictable events: case, instance/classifier for groups: batch, group
gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi

sentences.english: I plucked up the courage to ask her out. She agreed.
sentences.chinese: 後來，我終於鼓起勇氣單獨約她出去。

sentences.english: Have courage and ask. Then you know what you have to deal with.
sentences.chinese: 鼓起勇氣去問問他，然後你就知道你改怎麼做了。

sentences.english: Berenice strove valiantly to retain a serene interest.
sentences.chinese: 白麗萊茜鼓起勇氣保持一種冷靜的興趣。

sentences.english: She's mustering up courage to face the future.
sentences.chinese: 她重新鼓起勇氣面對未來。

sentences.english: Last year I summoned up the courage to paint them.
sentences.chinese: 去年我鼓起勇氣把它們全體粉刷了。

sentences.english: He mustered up courage to climb the cliff.
sentences.chinese: 他鼓起勇氣攀登那個峭壁。

sentences.english: And then at last, he nerved himself to let me take my violin up again.
sentences.chinese: 然後他終於鼓起勇氣，讓我再拿起小提琴。

sentences.english: To prepare for an attack by raiders, Kardaine prays to the Father to inspire courage.
sentences.chinese: 爲了抵禦掠襲者攻擊，卡典向天父祈禱讓他鼓起勇氣。

sentences.english: He got his spunk up and told the truth.
sentences.chinese: 他鼓起勇氣，說出了真相。

sentences.english: Excited , Bud finds the courage to ask Fran out .
sentences.chinese: 巴德興高采烈，鼓起勇氣約弗蘭出去。

sentences.english: He summoned his courage and entered the deserted house.
sentences.chinese: 他鼓起勇氣，走進那間荒廢的老屋。

sentences.english: And she finally worked up the nerve to tell her.
sentences.chinese: 最終她鼓起勇氣告白了。

sentences.english: Xi Ping finally confesses his feelings for Shu Ya.
sentences.chinese: 希平終於鼓起勇氣向舒雅告白。

sentences.english: It was not until 40 years later that I plucked up enough courage to read through Dong Jian.
sentences.chinese: 直到四十年後才鼓起勇氣讀了《通鑑》一遍。

sentences.english: He, at last, hardened and talked about his own thoughts.
sentences.chinese: 最後，他終於鼓起勇氣談出了他自己的想法。

sentences.english: Ep691 - Shuibo eventually proposes to Huixin. Huixin gives her consent without hesitation.
sentences.chinese: 水波鼓起勇氣向蕙心求婚，終獲得蕙心的允許。

definition: to answer/to respond/to answer positively/to agree/to accept/to promise
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
once/already/former/previously/ever/(past tense marker used before verb or clause)
to open one's mouth/to start to talk
(of a person) to turn round/to face about/(of a widow) to remarry (archaic)
to take the initiative/to do sth of one's own accord/spontaneous/active/opposite: passive 被動|被动[bei4 dong4]/drive (of gears and shafts etc)
but/yet/however/while/to go back/to decline/to retreat/nevertheless/even though
